item.title: We Were Selling Computers All Wrong
item.description: Today in Tedium: The big-box technology store isn’t dead yetâ€”and in the case of Best Buy, it’s actually doing pretty well, beating financial estimates by a country mile. But as a whole, the concept of the sprawling electronics chain is far from its peak. In fact, it’s sort of another shade of the office-supply store. Despite that, investors keep trying to revive this idea. Right now, an investor named Ronny Shmoel is trying to bring Circuit City back to life as a physical presence, roughly seven years after the brand was mothballed.
